ORDER

This petition is filed by the accused involved in C.C. No.
718 of 2001, on the files of the Judicial First Class Magistrate
Court, Ottappalam, which has been transferred to the register
of Long Pending cases as L.P.No.61 of 2010.

2. The petitioner seeks for quashing the proceedings in
C.C. No.718 of 2001, on the ground that, the issue involved
therein has been amicably settled among the defacto
complainant and himself. On 19.12.2018, this Court had
directed the petitioner to surrender before the court concerned,
which has been in seizin of the same and to pay the amount
covered by the bond executed by him, if he was released on
bail by the investigating officer during investigation. This Court
had also directed to grant him bail in the event of filing of an
application by him seeking for the same, without insisting for
sureties.

3. It is submitted by the learned counsel for the
petitioner that he had surrendered before the court and bail
was granted to him. A memo is also submitted across the bar
by the learned counsel for the petitioner, which was issued by

Peal
Crl.MC.No. 8716 of 2018 3 2019 1KERIIS?
the Junior Superintendent of the Judicial First Class Magistrate
Court, Ottappalam dated 27.12.2018. It is disclosed therefrom
that the court concerned had recalled the Non Bailable Warrant
issued against the accused.

4. The learned counsel for the petitioner has submitted
that the case has now been removed from the Long Pending
Register and renumbered as C.C. No.1086 of 2018. According
to the learned counsel, the matter has been settled among the
defacto complainant and the petitioner and swearing to those
aspects an affidavit has been filed by the defacto complainant.
The affidavit is produced along with the petition as Annexure-
III and it is stated therein that, the issues involved in the case
have been amicably settled among the defacto complaint
himself and the petitioner. Therefore, he has no objection in
recording the case as settled and quashing the proceedings in
Crime No.36 of 2001, which is pending before the Judicial First
Class Magistrate Court, Ottappalam now as C.C.No.1086 of
2018 (originally as C.C.No.718 of 2001). In view of the
settlement of the issues among the parties as established from
the affidavit available and the same having also been endorsed
by the learned Public Prosecutor, this Court is inclined to allow
this application.

Crl.MC.No. 8716 of 2018 4 2019 1KERIIS?
In the result, Crl.M.C. stands allowed. All further
proceedings initiated pursuant to C.C. No.718 of 2001, which is
now renumbered as C.C. No.1086 of 2018 stands quashed
